articles.headline: Supreme Court Dismisses SpiceJet Appeal in Share Transfer Arbitration Case
articles.summary: The Supreme Court rejected SpiceJet's challenge against an order to deposit ₹144 crore in a long-standing dispute with former promoter Kalanithi Maran. The court also imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on the airline for its failure to fulfill previous obligations.

articles.headline: CBI Court Rules Against Probes Based Solely on Election Funding
articles.summary: Special Judge Jitendra Singh held that investigations cannot be initiated based solely on allegations of election funding irregularities. The court ruled that the exclusive prerogative to examine such matters rests with the Election Commission of India.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Rejects West Bengal's Objections to Voter Roll Training
articles.summary: The Supreme Court dismissed West Bengal's concerns regarding ECI training modules for judicial officers overseeing the revision of electoral rolls. The court affirmed that the judicial officers will work independently to ensure a fair process.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Affirms Parliament’s Absolute Right to Enact Laws
articles.summary: The Supreme Court ruled that Parliament has the absolute prerogative to enact laws and is not bound by undertakings given by the government to the court. The bench was hearing pleas regarding the validity of the new sedition law provision.

articles.headline: Supreme Court rejects appeals against Sarda Energy’s acquisition of SKS Power
articles.summary: The Supreme Court upheld Sarda Energy’s resolution plan for SKS Power, chiding losing bidders for strategic delays. The ruling reinforces the commercial wisdom of lenders and the time-bound nature of insolvency laws.

articles.headline: Supreme Court refuses to stay ₹144.5 crore deposit order against SpiceJet
articles.summary: The SC upheld a Delhi High Court order requiring SpiceJet to deposit funds in its dispute with KAL Airways. The airline has been rebuked for prolonging litigation and ordered to pay ₹1 lakh in costs.

articles.headline: Karnataka HC orders restoration of storm water drains near Subramanyapura lake
articles.summary: The Karnataka High Court dismissed petitions by apartment associations and directed the Greater Bengaluru Authority to inspect and restore storm water drains. The court emphasized that preserving these water arteries is crucial to preventing the frequent flooding seen in upscale city areas.

articles.headline: CCB arrests businessman and supplier for illegal possession of pistol
articles.summary: Bengaluru's Central Crime Branch arrested S Syed Masood and his supplier, Javed Alam, for the illegal possession of a 0.32 mm pistol and cartridges. Masood, a sheep rearer, claimed he acquired the weapon for personal protection.

articles.headline: Gold and valuables worth 12 lakh stolen from railway official's quarters
articles.summary: A South Western Railway loco pilot filed a police complaint after gold and valuables worth ₹12 lakh were stolen from his official quarters in broad daylight. The thief gained entry by picking the lock while the pilot and his wife were away for their son's school admission.

articles.headline: Bengaluru police seize drugs worth 2.62 crore and arrest sixteen people
articles.summary: City police arrested 16 individuals, including nine foreign nationals, in various drug-related cases across Bengaluru. The seizure included MDMA pills, crystal meth, and hydro ganja, with two foreign nationals subsequently deported for their involvement.

articles.headline: Woman surrenders after stabbing gym trainer boyfriend in Bidadi
articles.summary: A 30-year-old woman named Sudha surrendered to Bidadi police after stabbing her gym trainer boyfriend, Venugopal, following a heated argument. The attack was reportedly triggered by the victim distancing himself from her, leading to her walk-in confession at the station.

articles.headline: Police book BJP MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal for hate speech
articles.summary: Yadgir police registered a case against BJP MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal following controversial remarks about Mahatma Gandhi and Jawaharlal Nehru. Yatnal is accused of promoting communal enmity and intentionally insulting national figures during a public speech.

articles.headline: Shivamogga police arrest three for 82 crore nationwide cyber fraud
articles.summary: Police in Shivamogga arrested three individuals allegedly involved in a cyber fraud network that defrauded victims across 352 cases nationwide of over ₹82 crore. Authorities seized 15 mule bank accounts, QR code scanners, and multiple SIM cards used to execute the scams.

articles.headline: Employee arrested for stealing 91 lakh from Bengaluru real estate firm
articles.summary: Sadashivanagar police arrested a real estate firm accountant and his friend for stealing ₹91 lakh in cash from their office on BEL Road. The police recovered ₹81 lakh of the stolen funds and are searching for two other accomplices involved in the theft.

articles.headline: Shivamogga man sentenced to life for murdering neighbor over affair
articles.summary: A Shivamogga court sentenced Manju Naik to life imprisonment for intentionally mowing down a neighbor with a car in August 2023. The crime was motivated by an affair the accused had with the victim's wife, leading to a deliberate fatal collision.

articles.headline: Kerala High Court allows release of The Kerala Story 2
articles.summary: A division bench of the Kerala High Court stayed a previous order that halted the screening of 'The Kerala Story 2 – Goes Beyond' for 15 days. The court noted that the CBFC certification carries a presumption of legality, allowing the film to release in over 1,800 theaters.

articles.headline: Supreme Court warns against creating anti-investment climate through judicial review
articles.summary: The Supreme Court emphasized that constitutional courts must be cautious not to hinder national investment through judicial reviews of laws. The bench made these remarks during a hearing regarding private player liability in nuclear power plants.

articles.headline: Jayanagar businessman arrested for procuring illegal pistol for self-protection
articles.summary: Police arrested Syed Masood for allegedly purchasing a country-made pistol and 50 rounds of ammunition. He claimed the weapon was for protection from his girlfriend's family, who opposed their relationship.

articles.headline: Kerala police arrest drug peddler in Bengaluru with MDMA worth 1cr
articles.summary: A native of Assam working as a food-delivery agent was arrested in Electronics City for drug trafficking. Police seized MDMA pills worth over Rs 1 crore hidden in infant cereal packs.

articles.headline: High Court orders re-inspection of lands over stormwater drain encroachments
articles.summary: The Karnataka High Court has ordered a fresh survey of lands in Gubbalala village to address drain encroachments by apartment complexes. If alternative alignments aren't proposed, the civic body must restore the original drains to prevent flooding.

articles.headline: Supreme Court stays order annulling election of Congress MLA Subbareddy
articles.summary: The Supreme Court has stayed a Karnataka High Court judgment that had set aside the election of SN Subbareddy from Bagepalli. The MLA will continue in his role pending further legal proceedings regarding asset disclosure.

articles.headline: Supreme Court grants bail to Congress MLA Vinay Kulkarni in murder case
articles.summary: In a major development, the Supreme Court has granted bail to MLA Vinay Kulkarni in the decade-old Yogesh Gowda murder case. Kulkarni was previously denied bail over concerns about influencing witnesses.

articles.headline: Supreme Court reprimands West Bengal government for delaying electoral roll revision
articles.summary: The Supreme Court criticized the West Bengal government for repeatedly filing petitions that delay the completion of state electoral rolls. The bench emphasized that the Special Intensive Revision must be completed without irrelevant excuses.

articles.headline: Murder convicts threaten judge in Bijnor court after life sentence verdict
articles.summary: Two men sentenced to life in prison for murder issued death threats to a judge inside a Bijnor courtroom. Security was immediately increased at the judge's residence following the chilling courtroom outburst.

articles.headline: FIR registered after hate graffiti appears on Delhi-Dehradun Expressway
articles.summary: Uttar Pradesh police filed a case against unidentified members of a Hindu outfit for writing communal messages on highway barriers. The graffiti stated the road was not for Muslims, leading to immediate police action to paint over it.

articles.headline: Three bank managers arrested for facilitating 182 crore cyberfraud through mule accounts
articles.summary: Police in Gujarat arrested three private bank executives for bypassing rules to open accounts used by scammers. These accounts were used to launder money from victims across multiple Indian states.

articles.headline: CBI challenges trial court’s discharge of Kejriwal and others in High Court
articles.summary: Hours after the trial court's verdict, the CBI moved the Delhi High Court to appeal the discharge of 23 accused. The agency claims the court ignored critical evidence and may seek to expunge remarks against its officers.

articles.headline: Special Court recommends departmental inquiry against CBI investigating officer
articles.summary: The judge discharging AAP leaders recommended an inquiry against the CBI's IO for "conscious abuse of official position." The court described the agency’s case as demonstrably erroneous and legally unsustainable.

articles.headline: High Court allows BJP’s Parivartan Yatra in West Bengal with restrictions
articles.summary: The Calcutta High Court has granted permission for the BJP to hold its political rally across West Bengal. The court set riders including a 1,000-person crowd limit and strict timings for the meetings.

articles.headline: Afghanistan and Pakistan Trade Fire Amid Escalating Border Tensions
articles.summary: Military installations along the Afghanistan-Pakistan border were attacked, resulting in several casualties and an 'open war' declaration by Islamabad. While Kabul has called for dialogue, Iran has offered to facilitate negotiations to defuse the conflict.

articles.headline: Nepal Prepares for National Elections Focused on Job Creation
articles.summary: Nearly 19 million voters in Nepal will head to the polls on March 5 to elect a 275-member house of representatives. India and China are closely watching the election, which is dominated by concerns over the economy and youth unemployment.

articles.headline: Bangladesh Army Reshuffles Leadership After Prime Minister Tarique Rahman Takes Office
articles.summary: The Bangladesh Army has appointed new top-level officers, replacing an incumbent perceived to be close to Pakistan. This marks the second major reshuffle in the army's senior leadership in less than 10 days following the power shift.

articles.headline: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq Urges Pakistan and Afghanistan to Resolve Conflict
articles.summary: Kashmiri leader Mirwaiz Umar Farooq called for dialogue between Pakistan and Afghanistan following border clashes. He also expressed concern that US military activity in the region signals a possible imminent attack on Iran.

articles.headline: OpenAI Raises $110 Billion from Amazon, Nvidia, and SoftBank
articles.summary: OpenAI has secured $110 billion in a new funding round that values the ChatGPT maker at $840 billion. Major contributors include Amazon with $50 billion, and SoftBank and Nvidia with $30 billion each.

articles.headline: Canadian PM Mark Carney arrives in Mumbai to reset bilateral ties
articles.summary: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney has arrived in Mumbai for a four-day visit aimed at expanding economic engagement and resetting relations with India. Carney is scheduled to hold formal talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on March 2.

articles.headline: China dismisses nine military officers ahead of annual legislative meeting
articles.summary: China's legislature has removed 19 members, including nine high-ranking military officers, as part of an ongoing anti-corruption campaign. The dismissals are seen as part of President Xi Jinping's efforts to ensure loyalty and modernize the armed forces before the National People's Congress.

articles.headline: Bill Clinton testifies before US panel regarding ties to Jeffrey Epstein
articles.summary: Former US President Bill Clinton appeared before a Congressional panel to answer questions about his past connections to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. While Clinton denied any wrongdoing and stated he broke ties in the early 2000s, the deposition comes amidst intense partisan scrutiny of various public figures' links to Epstein.

articles.headline: US and Iran conclude indirect nuclear negotiations in Geneva without agreement
articles.summary: Indirect negotiations between the United States and Iran over Tehran's nuclear program ended in Geneva without a breakthrough. While mediators noted some progress, Iran continues to demand the lifting of sanctions while refusing to transfer its enriched uranium abroad, leaving regional tensions high.

articles.headline: India monitors situation as Pakistan and Afghanistan enter open conflict
articles.summary: The Indian government is closely monitoring the escalating military situation between Pakistan and Afghanistan. Officials stated that Pakistan's actions are likely a ploy to deflect from its own internal domestic failures.

articles.headline: US allows non-emergency embassy staff to leave Jerusalem amid tensions
articles.summary: The United States has authorized non-emergency staff at its Jerusalem embassy to depart as regional tensions rise. President Trump expressed dissatisfaction with Iran but indicated a preference for a deal over military force.

articles.headline: Kalapani border dispute becomes prominent campaign issue in Nepal elections
articles.summary: The territorial dispute between India and Nepal over the Kalapani region has resurfaced as a major talking point in Nepal's upcoming parliamentary elections. Major parties are using the issue to appeal to nationalistic sentiments among voters.

articles.headline: Congress Claims BJP-AAP Nexus Led to Kejriwal’s Acquittal
articles.summary: The Congress party alleged that the BJP and AAP have a nexus, leading to Arvind Kejriwal's acquittal ahead of upcoming elections. Party spokespeople suggested the BJP uses central agencies as electoral tools to help 'convenient allies.'

articles.headline: BJP Terms Kejriwal’s Acquittal a Technical Matter Due to Evidence Lack
articles.summary: The BJP downplayed the court's discharge of Arvind Kejriwal, calling it a technical outcome resulting from the alleged destruction of mobile phones and SIM cards. The party stated that the CBI will decide its next legal steps after studying the judgment.

articles.headline: Election Commission Considers Single-Phase Polls for Tamil Nadu Assembly
articles.summary: CEC Gyanesh Kumar stated that the Election Commission will decide on holding Tamil Nadu state elections in a single phase following requests from political parties. He anticipated high voter turnout from the region's politically aware electorate.

articles.headline: PM Modi describes Union Budget as policy roadmap rather than trading document
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi downplayed stock market volatility, stating the budget represents a long-term national journey. He urged the industry to focus on fresh investments and innovation rather than short-term gains.

articles.headline: India seeks best trade deal with US amid tariff uncertainties
articles.summary: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal stated India is focused on securing a deal that ensures a competitive edge. The statement follows the US Supreme Court's decision to invalidate President Trump's sweeping emergency tariffs.

articles.headline: Robert Vadra distances himself from Karnataka's internal leadership issues
articles.summary: Businessman Robert Vadra clarified that he will not interfere in Karnataka state politics during a recent visit to Bengaluru. He stated that his family would help settle any leadership disputes between CM Siddaramaiah and DCM DK Shivakumar only if asked by the party.

articles.headline: Congress MLAs meet over dinner to seek clarity on Karnataka leadership
articles.summary: A group of 23 Congress MLAs supportive of DK Shivakumar met at a private dinner to discuss approaching the party high command for leadership clarity. The meeting has fueled speculation regarding a potential leadership transition within the Karnataka state government.

articles.headline: Senior Dalit leaders express frustration over Karnataka Chief Minister leadership race
articles.summary: A section of senior Dalit leaders is reportedly upset with AICC President Mallikarjuna Kharge for not considering a Dalit for the Chief Minister post. They have urged Kharge to either take the role himself or promote a Dalit leader to create political history in the state.

articles.headline: Deve Gowda leaves son's Chief Ministerial prospects to BJP leadership
articles.summary: JDS supremo HD Deve Gowda stated that the decision to make his son HD Kumaraswamy the next Chief Minister of Karnataka rests with PM Narendra Modi and Amit Shah. Gowda emphasized the strength of the BJP-JDS alliance and criticized the current Congress government's guarantee schemes.

articles.headline: DK Shivakumar welcomes Supreme Court's decision to grant bail to Vinay Kulkarni
articles.summary: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar expressed satisfaction after the Supreme Court granted bail to Congress MLA Vinay Kulkarni. Kulkarni, who was previously barred from entering his constituency, received support from Shivakumar who called the ordeal a victory for justice.

articles.headline: Appointment of KN Anuradha as Bengaluru Rural DC sparks controversy
articles.summary: The appointment of KN Anuradha as the Bengaluru Rural Deputy Commissioner has triggered backlash as she is the wife of Minister KH Muniyappa’s personal secretary. The move has led to allegations of political favoritism, as the previous DC was removed after only one year.

articles.headline: BJP and AGP set to finalize Assam election alliance by March
articles.summary: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced that the BJP's seat-sharing agreement with the AGP and BPF for the upcoming Assembly elections should be finalized by March 10. The BJP is launching a "Jan Ashirwad Yatra" this weekend to kick off its campaign.

articles.headline: Bihar BJP legislators demand strict anti-conversion law in assembly
articles.summary: Several BJP MLAs in the Bihar Assembly called for a stringent anti-conversion law similar to those implemented in states like Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat. The Speaker assured the House that the government would review existing laws to potentially implement a ban on forced religious conversions.

articles.headline: Amit Shah chairs high-level security meeting on Indo-Nepal border
articles.summary: Union Home Minister Amit Shah met with Bihar officials in Purnea to discuss border security and smuggling issues along the Indo-Nepal frontier. Following the meeting, the state government announced a special probe into allegations of land encroachment by outsiders in Kishanganj.

articles.headline: Controversy erupts in Punjab over alleged police encounter of teenager
articles.summary: The death of 19-year-old Ranjit Singh in an alleged encounter with Punjab Police has sparked demands for a CBI inquiry by family members and opposition leaders. While police linked the youth to the killing of two officers, his family claims he was picked up from home and killed in custody.

articles.headline: BJP veteran BS Yediyurappa celebrates 84th birthday in home town
articles.summary: Former Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa celebrated his 84th birthday with special prayers and events in Shikaripura. Leaders from various political parties extended greetings to the veteran politician on his 50 years in public life.

articles.headline: Karnataka Deputy CM says welfare guarantee schemes will continue despite burden
articles.summary: Deputy CM DK Shivakumar affirmed that the state's five guarantee schemes will not be revised despite being a strain on the exchequer. He emphasized that the focus is on strengthening families financially while rooting out implementation irregularities.

articles.headline: Opposition leader Ashoka claims Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has strengthened his position
articles.summary: R Ashoka stated that CM Siddaramaiah is unlikely to step down as he has consolidated power within the Congress party. He criticized the internal discord and claimed the high command has failed to control infighting.

articles.headline: Congress and BJP shortlist candidates for upcoming bypolls in Karnataka
articles.summary: Political parties are gearing up for by-elections in Davanagere South and Bagalkot constituencies. Both sides are treating the contests as high-stakes battles to assert leadership and consolidate voter bases.

articles.headline: Arvind Kejriwal demands apology from PM Modi following court discharge
articles.summary: Following his discharge in the excise policy case, Arvind Kejriwal called the probe a "political conspiracy" to crush AAP. He challenged the Prime Minister to hold fresh assembly elections in Delhi.

articles.headline: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta labels excise case discharge as misleading clean chit
articles.summary: CM Rekha Gupta stated that the court verdict is not the final truth and that Arvind Kejriwal remains guilty in the eyes of the public. She questioned why the controversial policy was withdrawn if it was legitimate.

articles.headline: AAP redrafts Punjab election strategy following court victory in Delhi
articles.summary: AAP leaders were reportedly surprised by the total discharge of all accused and are now planning to revive their "anti-corruption" narrative. The party aims to use the verdict to boost its campaign in Punjab's upcoming assembly polls.

articles.headline: Andhra Pradesh Opens Coastline for Rare Earth and Titanium Mining
articles.summary: The Andhra Pradesh government is opening its coastline for beach sand mining to extract rare earths and titanium-based minerals. This move aims to reduce India's dependence on Chinese-dominated supply chains and create a manufacturing hub.

articles.headline: India Accepts Third Party Mediation in EU Free Trade Agreement
articles.summary: In a first for its trade deals, India has accepted third-party involvement to resolve disputes in the India-EU FTA. New Delhi must also consult the EU before imposing export duties on non-agricultural products that have an adverse impact.

articles.headline: India Adopts New GDP Series as Q3 Growth Hits 7.8%
articles.summary: The government has transitioned to a new GDP series with FY23 as the base year, revealing 7.8% growth in the December quarter. Full-year FY26 growth is now projected at 7.6%, up from previous estimates.

articles.headline: India’s Nominal GDP Forecast Reduced by 3.3% Under New Series
articles.summary: Under the revamped GDP series, India's nominal GDP for FY26 is estimated at ₹345 lakh crore, a 3.3% drop from previous estimates. This statistical adjustment could delay the timeline for India becoming a $4 trillion economy until FY28.

articles.headline: Revised GDP Calculations May Impact India's Fiscal Deficit Targets
articles.summary: Economists suggest that a lower-than-expected nominal GDP under the new series will make meeting fiscal deficit targets more challenging. The budgeted deficit for FY27 could rise to 4.46% of GDP due to the revised statistical base.

articles.headline: India Launches National Fibre Scheme to Rationalize Raw Material Imports
articles.summary: The textiles ministry is developing the National Fibre Scheme to bridge quality gaps and promote domestic sourcing. The mission aims to increase India's global share in fibre production to 12% while creating eight million jobs by 2030.

articles.headline: Controller General of Accounts Launches Real-Time Government Bank Dashboard
articles.summary: A new real-time dashboard and standardized manual have been introduced to tighten compliance and accountability in government bank transactions. The system shifts oversight to proactive performance management to safeguard public funds.

articles.headline: India's FDI Equity Inflows Rise 16.6% in Third Quarter
articles.summary: FDI equity inflows into India reached $12.69 billion in October-December FY26, according to DPIIT data. Singapore and the US remained the top sources of investment, with Maharashtra attracting the highest state-level inflows.

articles.headline: Bihar Assembly Passes Bill to Regulate Microfinance Institutions
articles.summary: Bihar has enacted legislation to regulate microfinance institutions, including a limit of two lenders per borrower. Industry experts warn that the state regulation could hinder sector recovery and lead to increased repayment delinquencies.

articles.headline: Gold Loans Grow by 128% in January as Credit Demand Surges
articles.summary: Loans against gold grew by 128% year-on-year in January, outpacing all other loan products. Retail lending remained strong, while corporate sector growth also improved to 12%, up from 8% a year ago.

articles.headline: Average Lending Rates on New Rupee Loans Rise in January
articles.summary: The weighted average lending rate on fresh rupee loans rose 39 basis points to 8.67% in January. The increase was primarily driven by state-run banks, even as the Reserve Bank has lowered the repo rate over the past year.

articles.headline: India GDP grows at 7.8% in Q3 under new data series
articles.summary: India's economy grew at a faster pace of 7.8% in the October-December quarter under a revised methodology. The government has raised the FY26 growth outlook to 7.6% while maintaining a strong manufacturing performance.

articles.headline: Revised GDP methodology shrinks India’s economy by ₹11 trillion in nominal terms
articles.summary: India’s updated GDP series with a 2022-23 base year has reduced the country's nominal output size. This revision may complicate fiscal deficit targets and delay India's goal of becoming a $4-trillion economy.

articles.headline: India's GDP growth estimate raised to 7.6% for FY26
articles.summary: The Ministry of Statistics released a new National Accounts series with 2022-23 as the base year, raising the real GDP growth estimate for FY26 to 7.6%. Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran noted that the revision aims to better capture structural changes through double deflation methods.

articles.headline: NABARD projects 4.99 lakh crore credit potential for Karnataka
articles.summary: NABARD has estimated an exploitable credit potential of ₹4.99 lakh crore for Karnataka for the 2026-27 financial year, marking a 12% increase. The projected credit is focused on agriculture, MSMEs, and rural infrastructure to foster capital formation in the state.

articles.headline: CEA predicts India will reach 4 trillion dollar economy by FY27
articles.summary: Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran stated that India is firmly on course to become a $4 trillion economy by the 2026-27 financial year. While the current nominal GDP revised downward under the new series, the CEA highlighted strong domestic growth and improving trade outlooks.

articles.headline: Coal India ensures sufficient stocks to meet peak summer electricity demand
articles.summary: Coal India Limited announced that it holds record pithead stocks of 115 million tonnes, ensuring enough supply to meet the anticipated rise in summer power demand. This three-layer buffer is expected to provide operational stability and potentially reduce the need for coal imports.

articles.headline: Bengaluru property owners rush to clear tax dues to avoid auctions
articles.summary: Fourteen property owners in Bommanahalli settled over Rs 27 lakh in pending taxes following auction announcements. Civic officials are using public auctions as a last resort to recover nearly Rs 1.1 crore in outstanding dues.

articles.headline: R Ashoka alleges Mysore Silk units threatened by proposed stadium project
articles.summary: The Leader of the Opposition claimed that the Karnataka Silk Industries Corporation is being targeted by a land diversion plan. He warned that building a stadium on factory land could harm the profit-making PSU and its workers.

articles.headline: Chief Economic Adviser raises India's growth forecast to 7.4 percent
articles.summary: V Anantha Nageswaran has increased the economic growth forecast, citing policy certainty and improved capital flows. He predicts the Indian economy will likely cross the $4 trillion mark next year.

articles.headline: India’s fiscal deficit pegged at 4.5 percent following GDP rebasing
articles.summary: Following the revision of GDP base years, the fiscal deficit for FY26 is now estimated at 4.5%. This may necessitate a reduction in government spending to meet the original 4.4% target.

articles.headline: PM Modi urges private sector to boost investment and infrastructure funding
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi called on the industry to innovate and adopt new models for infrastructure development. He emphasized that reforms should be evaluated based on their impact at the ground level.

articles.headline: IndiGo Secures Japanese Equity Funding for Two Airbus A320 Aircraft
articles.summary: IndiGo has used Japanese Operating Lease with Call Option (JOLCO) financing to procure two new aircraft via GIFT City. This is the first time an Indian carrier has successfully tapped Japanese equity funding, which is typically cheaper than debt.

articles.headline: Fino Payments Bank MD Rishi Gupta Arrested for GST Fraud
articles.summary: The managing director of Fino Payments Bank was arrested by the DGGI in connection with an investigation into fake invoices. The bank's board has appointed CFO Ketan Merchant as the interim head to oversee day-to-day operations.

articles.headline: Indian Stock Indices Drop Over 1% Amid AI-Led IT Sell-Off
articles.summary: The Sensex and Nifty fell over 1% on the last trading day of February, concluding a month marked by heavy selling in IT stocks. Tech stocks recorded their steepest monthly drop in 17 years due to concerns over AI-led business disruptions.

articles.headline: Indian Corporate Boards Shift Focus to AI Strategy and Future Gains
articles.summary: Corporate boards in India are moving beyond basic AI experimentation to focus on measurable outcomes and time-bound roadmaps. Many companies are also inducting tech-savvy members to help navigate the rapid shift toward AI integration.

articles.headline: Executive Search Firms Bullish on India Despite Global AI Disruption
articles.summary: Global search firms like Heidrick & Struggles and Korn Ferry remain optimistic about the Indian market for senior leadership. India is increasingly seen as a global leadership pool, with senior hiring demand remaining strong across non-IT sectors.

articles.headline: Global Automakers Increase India Sales Targets Amid Robust Demand
articles.summary: Suzuki and Hyundai are raising production and sales forecasts for India, citing strong demand following GST revisions. India is currently the world’s third-largest car market and acts as a major manufacturing hub for global exports.

articles.headline: Indian Restaurant Chains Launch New Strategies to Boost Dine-In Sales
articles.summary: Major chains like KFC and Starbucks are introducing dine-in exclusive menus and targeted discounts to lure customers back to physical stores. This strategy aims to improve margins by reducing reliance on delivery aggregator commissions.

articles.headline: GST Intelligence Agency Unearths ₹593-Crore Fake Invoice Racket in Bengaluru
articles.summary: The DGGI has busted a massive fraudulent input tax credit racket involving over ₹235 crore in wrongful tax claims. The alleged mastermind was arrested in Bengaluru after search operations at multiple suspect GST registrations.

articles.headline: Shriram Pistons Raises ₹1,000 Crore to Fund Grupo Antolin Acquisition
articles.summary: Shriram Pistons and Rings raised ₹1,000 crore via NCDs to finance the acquisition of Spanish firm Grupo Antolin's Indian entities. The move allows the company to diversify beyond powertrain components into automotive interiors.

articles.headline: IIFL Home Finance Signs $300 Million Loan Agreement with ADB
articles.summary: IIFL Home Finance secured its first syndicated external commercial borrowing of $300 million from the Asian Development Bank and other lenders. The funds will be used to provide affordable and green housing loans to low-income women.

articles.headline: Japanese Firm Proterial Considers Local Manufacturing of EV Magnets in India
articles.summary: Japanese metal maker Proterial is evaluating plans to manufacture rare earth-free EV magnets and superalloys in India. The company aims to provide sustainable alternatives to Chinese-dominated supply chains for high-end materials.

articles.headline: SBI Leases Large Office Space in Navi Mumbai for IT Center
articles.summary: State Bank of India has leased 1.35 lakh sq ft in Navi Mumbai’s Airoli locality for its global capability and IT center. The 60-month lease involves a monthly rental expense of over ₹1.68 crore.

articles.headline: Nicobar founders discuss decade of relaxed luxury and new wedding wear
articles.summary: Founders Simran Lal and Raul Rai reflect on their ₹200-crore journey and shift toward comfortable silhouettes. They are now venturing into minimalist wedding wear and collaborating with designer Rajesh Pratap Singh.

articles.headline: New biography of Vaman Shridhar Apte explores Bombay’s industrial roots
articles.summary: Tejaswini Apte-Rahm’s book "Tatyasaheb" chronicles the life of an entrepreneur central to Mumbai's textile, sugar, and film industries. The biography offers rare insights into the Konkanastha Brahmin community's influence on the city's early commerce.

articles.headline: Geist Brewing CEO Narayan Manepally wins gold at European Beer Star
articles.summary: Bengaluru-based Geist Brewing Co. became the first Indian brewery to win a gold medal in the Hefeweizen Dunkel category. CEO Narayan Manepally discussed the company's 25% growth and plans for nationwide expansion.

articles.headline: Norway’s sovereign wealth fund excludes Adani Green Energy over corruption allegations
articles.summary: The world’s largest sovereign fund has ceased investment in Adani Green Energy, citing ethical concerns. The decision follows US legal proceedings against Adani executives, though the company maintains that it is not directly indicted.

articles.headline: India and EU agree to grant reciprocal MFN status for five years
articles.summary: A draft trade agreement indicates that India and the European Union will grant each other Most Favoured Nation status. The deal aims to boost trade relations and provide a stable framework for the next five years.

articles.headline: Deepinder Goyal’s Temple venture sets low body fat criteria for engineers
articles.summary: Zomato founder Deepinder Goyal's longevity startup Temple will only hire engineers with body fat below 16% for men. Legal experts suggest that while health criteria are permissible for specific roles, open-ended probation may face challenges.

articles.headline: Deepinder Goyal’s Eternal raises $54 million for performance wearable development
articles.summary: The startup raised $54 million at a $190 million valuation from a group of early Zomato investors. Eternal is assembling a "dream team" to build advanced wearable technology for elite athletes.

articles.headline: Jio Financial Services launches online marketplace for consumer loans and insurance
articles.summary: Jio Financial has debuted a comprehensive financial products marketplace through its new JioFinance app. Users can access home loans, credit cards, digital gold, and insurance services via an early access programme.

articles.headline: SGX President Michael Syn highlights India’s position as essential global market
articles.summary: Michael Syn stated that India’s growth trajectory makes it a market international investors cannot ignore. He emphasized the opportunity to integrate domestic liquidity in Mumbai with GIFT IFSC participation.

articles.headline: Domestic institutional investors led by SIP inflows reshape Indian IPO pricing
articles.summary: DIIs now dominate IPO anchor books, exerting greater valuation discipline than in previous cycles. Systematic investment plan inflows have created a deep liquidity pool that offsets recent foreign investor selling.

articles.headline: Foreign investor buying in February fails to lift overall market sentiment
articles.summary: Despite net FPI inflows of ₹22,615 crore, Indian markets remained edgy due to global tech weakness. Concerns over Smid-cap overvaluation and internal fraud at IDFC First Bank weighed on investor confidence.

articles.headline: Indian supplement makers shift toward plant protein as whey prices surge
articles.summary: Global supply constraints have pushed whey protein prices to multi-year highs, forcing brands to diversify. Companies like Marico and Fast&Up are expanding plant-based ranges to protect margins from currency and input volatility.

articles.headline: Maruti Suzuki plans monthly production of 2,000 EVs for domestic market
articles.summary: Maruti Suzuki will produce 2,000 units per month of its flagship eVitara model starting July. The company is calibrating capacity at its Gujarat facility to meet high domestic demand and export commitments.

articles.headline: Potential Paramount-Warner merger set to dominate Indian theatrical distribution
articles.summary: A merger between the legacy studios would control major franchises like Harry Potter and Mission: Impossible. Experts believe the deal will grant significant bargaining power with Indian multiplex chains like PVR Inox.

articles.headline: Indian paper industry seeks policy intervention against imports and fiber shortage
articles.summary: At a national seminar, leaders of the Indian paper industry warned that zero-duty imports and a domestic fiber shortage are threatening local manufacturing. The association called for a level playing field and more efficient wastepaper collection systems to sustain the eco-friendly sector.

articles.headline: India and EU release full text of free trade agreement
articles.summary: India and the European Union have released the 20-chapter text of their long-negotiated free trade agreement, covering digital trade, IPR, and sustainable development. The pact addresses contentious issues like the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) and is expected to be signed later this year.

articles.headline: Indian equity markets slump 2.5 percent amid global risk aversion
articles.summary: The Sensex and Nifty fell significantly this week as global tensions and high US bond yields triggered selling by foreign institutional investors. On Friday alone, the Sensex dropped 961 points, reflecting investor caution ahead of key domestic GDP growth data.

articles.headline: India faces 82 percent talent shortage as demand for AI skills surges
articles.summary: A survey by ManPower Group revealed that 82% of Indian employers are struggling to find skilled talent, with AI knowledge becoming the most sought-after expertise. The automotive and IT sectors reported the highest scarcity, indicating a structural transformation in the Indian labor market.

articles.headline: Maruti Suzuki plans 700 small-format premium outlets to target non-urban buyers
articles.summary: Maruti Suzuki India intends to open 700 NEXA Studio outlets by 2030 to attract premium car buyers in smaller cities and towns. These outlets will offer the same premium experience as metropolitan showrooms, including charging facilities for the company's upcoming electric vehicles.

articles.headline: Gold loans in India surge by 128 percent to cross 4L crore
articles.summary: Lending against gold jewellery has reached an all-time high, driven by rising gold prices and regulatory classification changes. Gold loans now account for a significant portion of incremental bank credit.

articles.headline: Jack Dorsey’s fintech firm Block to halve workforce to embed AI
articles.summary: Shares of Block surged after the company announced plans to significantly reduce its staff numbers. The move is part of an overhaul to integrate artificial intelligence across the company's operations.

articles.headline: Sensex crashes 961 points as geopolitical tensions and FPI selling intensify
articles.summary: Indian stock markets witnessed a sharp decline as investors worried about global trade tariffs and stalling US-Iran talks. Foreign funds led a massive sell-off, resulting in an investor wealth loss of Rs 5 lakh crore.

articles.headline: Small Finance Bank stocks drop following Bihar government’s new MFI bill
articles.summary: Shares of small finance banks fell after the Bihar government passed a bill restricting lending rates and operations. The new regulations cap the number of lenders an individual can borrow from, impacting MFI business models.

articles.headline: Jack Dorsey’s Block to Cut 4,000 Jobs in AI Productivity Bet
articles.summary: Fintech firm Block is reducing its workforce by nearly 50% as co-founder Jack Dorsey bets on AI to handle future labor tasks. The announcement led to a 27% surge in the company's stock during extended trading.

articles.headline: PM Modi to Inaugurate Micron’s First Indian Semiconductor Facility
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate US chipmaker Micron’s assembly and test facility in Sanand, Gujarat. This ₹22,500 crore project is the first major proposal approved under the India Semiconductor Mission.

articles.headline: India’s Semiconductor Market Expected to Reach $103 Billion by 2030
articles.summary: A report by Endiya Partners predicts India's chip market will double by 2030, driven by AI infrastructure, electric vehicles, and defense. The IndiaAI Mission is currently deploying 38,000 GPUs to meet data center demand.

articles.headline: Narayana Murthy Rejects AI Job Loss Fears, Cites Productivity Gains
articles.summary: Infosys founder Narayana Murthy asserted that technology typically expands employment opportunities by creating new roles and skill sets. He emphasized that AI tools will enhance productivity while legacy systems will continue to support tech roles.

articles.headline: Global Smartphone Market to Shrink 12.9% Due to Chip Shortage
articles.summary: The global smartphone market is predicted to contract by 12.9% in 2026 due to an unprecedented memory chip shortage. IDC predicts shipments will fall to 1.1 billion units, with entry-level Android devices most impacted by rising component costs.

articles.headline: India AI Impact Summit highlights challenges in reliable technology deployment
articles.summary: The AI Impact Summit in New Delhi addressed the need for reliable AI systems for infrastructure and healthcare. Discussions focused on India's "third way" strategy between market-led and state-driven models.

articles.headline: Insta360 launches shrunken X4 Air camera for portable action shooting
articles.summary: The new Insta360 X4 Air offers a more affordable and compact alternative to premium 360-degree cameras. It features waterproof design up to 15m and includes the replaceable lens system from higher-end models.

articles.headline: Research indicates AI-generated content is subtly reshaping human writing styles
articles.summary: Studies from the Max-Planck Institute show that humans are increasingly adopting language patterns typical of AI like ChatGPT. Professional writers now face the challenge of avoiding "glib" AI-style constructions to maintain human authenticity.

articles.headline: Karnataka CM calls for ethical standards in animation and gaming industry
articles.summary: Addressing the GAFX Summit, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah urged the animation and gaming sector to adopt ethical designs that avoid glorifying violence. He highlighted the industry's potential to create 20 lakh jobs in five years while emphasizing the protection of children's mental well-being.

articles.headline: Bengaluru to establish Center of Excellence for gaming industry
articles.summary: The Karnataka government has allocated ₹10 crore to establish a Center of Excellence in gaming in Bengaluru to boost startups and attract young talent. Officials also announced plans for a dedicated gaming summit to encourage global collaborations and training for 50,000 students.

articles.headline: Karnataka updates government computer literacy test with AI and cyber safety
articles.summary: The Karnataka government has revised its mandatory computer literacy test for employees to include Artificial Intelligence and cyber security fundamentals. The move aims to equip public servants with the skills needed for more secure digital operations and to defend against hacking threats.

articles.headline: AI startup Anthropic rejects Pentagon's demand for unrestricted military technology use
articles.summary: AI company Anthropic has refused a US Defense Department ultimatum to allow unrestricted military use of its technology by a Friday deadline. CEO Dario Amodei cited ethical concerns regarding mass surveillance and autonomous weapons, risking potential federal intervention under the Defense Production Act.

articles.headline: India's semiconductor mission enters critical 18-month execution phase
articles.summary: A new report suggests the next 18 months will determine the success of India's chip-making ambitions. Focus is shifting from policy announcements to on-ground facility execution and supply-chain development.

articles.headline: Dell Technologies shares jump as AI server revenue forecasts double
articles.summary: Dell shares reached a three-month high after the company predicted massive growth in its AI infrastructure business. Investors cheered the 103% projected rise in AI server revenue for the next fiscal year.

articles.headline: Prime Minister Modi to Launch Infrastructure Projects in South India
articles.summary: PM Narendra Modi will visit Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on March 1 to inaugurate infrastructure projects worth over ₹7,100 crore. The visit includes road and rail projects and a religious visit to Madurai’s Arulmigu Subramaniyaswamy Temple.

articles.headline: TRAI Proposes New Nine-Star Rating for Digital Connectivity in Real Estate
articles.summary: The telecom regulator has proposed a more granular nine-star rating system for digital connectivity readiness in properties. The move includes design-stage assessments to improve transparency for homebuyers and developers.

articles.headline: Government proposes easier storage and licensing norms for industrial gas cylinders
articles.summary: New proposals aim to relax compliance and allow higher stacking of industrial cylinders under safety standards. The move is expected to benefit commercial and industrial sectors involved in transporting compressed gases.

articles.headline: Farmers' association opposes land compensation process for Peripheral Ring Road
articles.summary: The PRR Farmers and Site Owners’ Association has criticized the state government's land acquisition process for the Peripheral Ring Road project. The group claims the compensation is unjust and violates the 2013 Land Acquisition Act by using outdated 2016 BDA rules.

articles.headline: Land acquisition and legal disputes delay Upper Krishna Project Phase 3
articles.summary: The ₹70,000 crore Upper Krishna Project (UKP-III) faces delays due to the challenge of acquiring 1.33 lakh acres of land and pending inter-state notifications. While the government has increased compensation rates, the project is essential for irrigating six lakh hectares in drought-prone North Karnataka.

articles.headline: Karnataka Cabinet approves 7,000 crore Cauvery 6th Stage project
articles.summary: The Karnataka Cabinet has approved the Cauvery 6th Stage water project at an estimated cost of ₹7,000 crore to meet the city's growing population needs. Deputy CM DK Shivakumar stated that the project will utilize 6 tmcft of water and seek financial assistance from JICA.

articles.headline: Energy Minister promises seven-hour uninterrupted power supply for farmers
articles.summary: Energy Minister KJ George announced that the Karnataka government is committed to providing seven hours of continuous power to agricultural pump sets. The plan involves expediting the solarization of agricultural feeders under the KUSUM-C scheme to generate 2,500 MW.

articles.headline: Passengers protest at Bengaluru airport after 18-hour flight delay
articles.summary: Travelers at Kempegowda International Airport staged a protest after being stranded for over 18 hours. The delay involved an Air India Express flight to Kathmandu that faced repeated weather-related diversions.

articles.headline: Illegal political banners and cutouts pose safety threat on Bengaluru roads
articles.summary: Thousands of illegal banners and wooden cutouts have appeared across Bengaluru ahead of upcoming local elections. Residents and traffic police warn that these structures obstruct visibility and create hazards for commuters.

articles.headline: BDA invites bids to lease commercial space in Malleswaram Market Complex
articles.summary: The Bangalore Development Authority is moving to operationalize the Malleswaram Market Complex by leasing out commercial facilities. The redevelopment project has faced numerous delays but is now ready for retail and office occupancy.

articles.headline: Land acquisition bottlenecks delay five new railway projects in Karnataka
articles.summary: The Central government informed Parliament that five new railway lines in Karnataka are facing significant delays due to land acquisition issues. Only a small fraction of the required 1,945 hectares has been acquired so far.

articles.headline: Technical hurdles in Western Ghats delay Vande Bharat service to Mangaluru
articles.summary: The introduction of Vande Bharat trains on the Bengaluru-Mangaluru route is delayed due to braking system requirements in the steep ghat sections. Railways are considering temporary solutions like attaching additional locomotives for the difficult terrain.

articles.headline: Australia Women Secure Series Win Over India with Five-Wicket Victory
articles.summary: Georgia Voll’s century powered Australia to a five-wicket win and a 2-0 lead in the three-match ODI series against India. India posted 251/9 but could not defend the total against the reigning world champions.

articles.headline: Bayern Munich Face Dortmund in Bundesliga Clash with Eight-Point Lead
articles.summary: Bayern Munich enters the 'Der Klassiker' match with a significant eight-point cushion over Borussia Dortmund. Bayern has dominated the rivalry since 2012, winning 12 of the last 13 Bundesliga meetings between the two sides.

articles.headline: Abhishek Sharma Ends Slump with Fifty Against Zimbabwe in World Cup
articles.summary: India opener Abhishek Sharma regained his form with a 55-run innings against Zimbabwe in the T20 World Cup. The performance provided relief to the team management following a series of low scores for the young batsman.

articles.headline: Viral fitness race Hyrox expands to Bengaluru, Mumbai and Delhi
articles.summary: The popular Hyrox fitness competition is set to debut in Bengaluru this April before moving to other Indian cities. The race combines 1km runs with functional workouts like sled pushes and rowing.

articles.headline: J&K CM Omar Abdullah arrives in Hubballi for Ranji final
articles.summary: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah traveled to Hubballi to support the state cricket team in their first-ever Ranji Trophy final. He expressed pride in the team's achievement and confidence in their victory against Karnataka.

articles.headline: India faces West Indies in T20 World Cup virtual quarterfinal
articles.summary: India will play the West Indies at Eden Gardens in a critical T20 World Cup Super Eights match that serves as a virtual quarterfinal. The contest pits the Caribbean side's aggressive boundary-hitting approach against India's bowling attack led by Jasprit Bumrah.

articles.headline: Security tightened at Eden Gardens ahead of India-West Indies match
articles.summary: Police have significantly increased security at Kolkata's Eden Gardens for Sunday's sold-out World Cup match between India and the West Indies. The heightened measures are partly due to the publication of final electoral lists in the city on the same weekend.

articles.headline: Indian cricketer Rinku Singh rejoins team after father's death
articles.summary: Indian cricketer Rinku Singh traveled to Aligarh for his father's final rites before rejoining the national team in Kolkata for the T20 World Cup. His father had been battling liver cancer, and Rinku's quick return to duty mirrors other recent examples of athletes grieving while on tour.

articles.headline: Punjab FC defeats Bengaluru FC 2-0 in Indian Super League
articles.summary: Effiong Nsungusi scored twice to lead Punjab FC to their first win of the season, upsetting Bengaluru FC at the Sree Kanteerava Stadium. Despite several changes and second-half attempts by Bengaluru, Punjab's defense held firm to maintain their clean sheet.

articles.headline: India’s top-order batters strike form against Zimbabwe in T20 World Cup
articles.summary: Abhishek Sharma and Hardik Pandya led a massive scoring effort as India posted 256 for 4 against Zimbabwe. The performance provides a timely boost to the team's confidence ahead of their virtual quarterfinal.

articles.headline: Pacer Arshdeep Singh warns against underestimating West Indies in upcoming match
articles.summary: Following his record-breaking performance against Zimbabwe, Arshdeep Singh emphasized that the West Indies are a versatile team. India's upcoming match at Eden Gardens is treated as a virtual quarterfinal.

articles.headline: Pakistan faces must-win situation against Sri Lanka in T20 World Cup
articles.summary: Pakistan's tournament hopes hang in the balance as they face Sri Lanka in a crucial Super 8s encounter. While Pakistan needs a dominant win to stay in contention, Sri Lanka is playing for pride after previous losses.

articles.headline: Will Jacks leads England to narrow victory over New Zealand
articles.summary: England secured a thrilling four-wicket win against New Zealand, thanks to a late-game surge by Will Jacks and Rehan Ahmed. The result keeps England at the top of Group 2 while leaving New Zealand's qualification uncertain.

articles.headline: Zimbabwe batter Brian Bennett clarifies his aggressive playing style
articles.summary: Despite his high-scoring run, Brian Bennett rejects being labeled a traditional "anchor" batter. He emphasized his focus on maintaining a high strike rate and playing positive cricket in the Power Play.

articles.headline: West Indies draw inspiration from 2016 victory ahead of India clash
articles.summary: The West Indies team is looking to relive their 2016 T20 World Cup triumph as they return to Eden Gardens. Coach Daren Sammy hopes the venue's history will provide a psychological edge against the Indian team.

articles.headline: Artist Olivia Fraser presents spiritual landscape exhibition in New Delhi
articles.summary: The British Council is hosting a solo exhibition titled "A Journey Within" featuring works by artist Olivia Fraser. The collection explores spiritual landscapes through Indian miniature and geometric painting traditions.

articles.headline: Sakshi Gallery celebrates 40 years with new Memory Keepers exhibition
articles.summary: Mumbai's Sakshi Gallery marks its 40th anniversary with an exhibition featuring artists like Debashish Paul and Hasan Ali Kadiwala. The show explores memory as a lived experience through diverse artistic mediums.

articles.headline: Major new films and series debut on global streaming platforms
articles.summary: Several highly anticipated titles including "Blossoms Shanghai" by Wong Kar-Wai and "The Bluff" starring Priyanka Chopra Jonas have premiered. Oscar nominee "The Secret Agent" and Maggie O’Farrell’s "Hamnet" are also hitting screens.

articles.headline: Tamil feature film premieres at Berlin International Film Festival
articles.summary: Director Gowtham’s debut feature "Members of the Problematic Family" premiered in the Forum section of the 76th Berlinale. The film offers a raw portrait of a family navigating grief and unusual turmoil.

articles.headline: Kochi-Muziris Biennale balances artistic spectacle with deep viewer engagement
articles.summary: The 2025-26 edition of the Kochi-Muziris Biennale features immersive installations like Birender Yadav’s brick kiln memorial and Jayashree Chakravarty’s "Shelter." Artists are urging viewers to move beyond social media consumption toward meaningful observation.

articles.headline: Lionsgate Play premieres hockey-themed erotic drama series Heated Rivalry
articles.summary: The new series explores a professional rivalry and romance between star ice hockey players Shane Hollander and Ilya Rozanov. Based on Rachel Reid's books, the show is gaining praise for its blend of sports and intimacy.

articles.headline: Historians launch YouTube channel exploring ancient food habits and paleobotanics
articles.summary: The @HistoricallyTempered channel features four educators explaining what ancient civilizations like the Cholas and Harappans ate. Using fossilized remains, they provide insights into the history of diet and agriculture.

articles.headline: Bolcha pottery studio offers immersive craft experiences in Coorg hills
articles.summary: Located on dental college grounds, Bolcha studio provides one-on-one sessions in wheel throwing and hand-building. Two Santiniketan-trained artists lead the creative space, offering visitors a unique memento of the region.

articles.headline: Medical drama The Pitt praised for multilingual realism and inclusivity
articles.summary: The television series "The Pitt" is gaining attention for its authentic use of languages like Tamil and Tagalog in hospital settings. The show's nuanced approach to diverse characters and medical emergencies has resonated with international audiences.

articles.headline: Ensemble returns to runway with intimate Ahmedabad fashion showcase
articles.summary: After two decades, multi-designer store Ensemble hosted a "slow" fashion show on the banks of the Sabarmati. The event featured 80 looks from 50 designers, focusing on clothes over social media spectacles.

articles.headline: Tribal home cooks bring indigenous recipes to Mumbai’s mainstream dining
articles.summary: A pop-up at Ishaara restaurant featured ceremonial foods from the Kinnaura, Koya, and Karbi tribes. These initiatives aim to place ancestral food traditions in contemporary dining spaces while honoring seasonal wisdom.

articles.headline: Vadodara’s snack heritage thrives through historic farsan shops and tradition
articles.summary: Establishments like Raju Khaman and Jagdish Foods continue to preserve Gujarat's rich "farsan" traditions. These snack shops serve as essential local hubs, offering everything from airy gram-flour cakes to spiced chevdo.

articles.headline: Mumbai’s sweet heritage reflects Portuguese, Irani, and local migrant influences
articles.summary: The city's dessert scene includes iconic items like Mahim halwa, ukadiche modak, and Parsi malai na khaja. Each sweetmeat tells a story of Mumbai's history, from colonial gentlemen's clubs to refugee camps.

articles.headline: Director Kaouther Ben Hania discusses film honoring Palestinian girl Hind Rajab
articles.summary: The film dramatizes the real-life pleas of five-year-old Hind Rajab, who was killed during the Gaza conflict. Ben Hania used actual audio recordings to create a respectful narrative that centers on the Palestinian perspective.

articles.headline: Hip-hop legend J Dilla’s Donuts album celebrated for humanizing machine-made beats
articles.summary: Twenty years after its release, J Dilla’s final album "Donuts" remains a blueprint for soulful beat-making. Produced largely from a hospital bed, the record infused electronic music with rhythmic imperfection and emotional depth.

articles.headline: Actor-politician Vijay's wife files for divorce alleging adultery and cruelty
articles.summary: Sankgeetha Vijay has filed a divorce petition against her husband, TVK leader and actor Vijay, in a Chengalpattu court. The petition alleges mental cruelty, neglect, and an extra-marital relationship, with a court hearing scheduled for April 20.

articles.headline: Historical Bengaluru Karaga scheduled for April 1 with grand celebrations
articles.summary: Muzrai Minister Ramalinga Reddy announced that the annual Bengaluru Karaga will be celebrated on April 1 with lighting and cultural events inspired by Mysuru Dasara. The 11-day festivities will include significant police security and infrastructure support from the city corporation.

articles.headline: Thousands of Indian pilgrims travel to Katchatheevu for annual festival
articles.summary: Nearly 4,000 Indian pilgrims have traveled to the uninhabited Katchatheevu islet to participate in a two-day religious festival. The event is a key cultural link between India and Sri Lanka, involving shared heritage and tradition.

articles.headline: Film Review: Super Hit is a conversational road trip comedy
articles.summary: The Kannada film "Super Hit" follows three strangers on a road trip, blending humor and mystery through their shifting identities and past secrets. While the film leans on dialogue and character quirks rather than heavy drama, it is noted for its rooted local humor and lighthearted tone.

articles.headline: Film Review: The Rise of Ashoka explores caste and dignity
articles.summary: Set in the 1970s, "The Rise of Ashoka" tells the story of a man from a barbering community fighting for dignity through education and government employment. While praised for its earnest performances, the film is criticized for shifting its focus to physical revenge in the second half.

articles.headline: Production begins for Kannada comedy thriller film Devi Mahatme
articles.summary: Director Nagaraj Somayaji has launched production for his new film, "Devi Mahatme," with a ceremony at the Sri Brahmi Durgaparameshwari Temple. The film is described as a comedy-thriller set in Kundapura and will feature a large ensemble cast.

articles.headline: Film Review: Accused is a fast-paced thriller about power and harassment
articles.summary: The Netflix film "Accused," starring Konkona Sensharma, explores the downfall of a powerful gynecologist facing sexual harassment allegations. While the film is noted for its engaging pace and layered lead performance, critics argue its focus on thrills overshadows its deeper feminist themes.

articles.headline: Bengaluru running group Free Runners celebrates 10th anniversary milestone
articles.summary: The Free Runners group celebrated a decade of activity at the RMV Club with members sharing success stories. Highlights included Manju Mittur qualifying for the Boston Marathon and other members completing various distance milestones.

articles.headline: Apartment residents in Bengaluru find innovative ways to build community
articles.summary: Bengaluru residents are transforming apartment complexes into support networks through activities like coffee meet-ups and cricket leagues. These initiatives help residents connect and overcome the isolation often found in urban living.

articles.headline: Children perform play on Lord Krishna’s life at Bengaluru apartment
articles.summary: A production titled 'Krishna – The Divine Journey' was staged by children at Salarpuria Sattva Magnificia. The play aimed to instill values and confidence in young participants aged between three and 14.

articles.headline: Sobha Indraprastha apartment hosts pre-Holi cultural celebration for seniors
articles.summary: Residents of Sobha Indraprastha organized a pre-Holi event featuring skits and dance recitals for senior citizens. The program included performances by local residents and traditional festive activities.

articles.headline: Bharatanatyam legend Padma Subrahmanyam reflects on 70 years of dance
articles.summary: Renowned dancer Padma Subrahmanyam shares insights into her career, including turning down film roles offered by MGR and Satyajit Ray. She emphasizes the transformative power of classical music and dance in society.

articles.headline: Rescued animals require stable routines to overcome early trauma and insecurity
articles.summary: The viral story of Punch the monkey highlights the importance of comfort items for abandoned animals. Veterinary experts recommend predictable feeding and sleep schedules to help rescued pets adjust to new homes.

articles.headline: Karnataka government doctors threaten total service shutdown over service demands
articles.summary: Medical staff associations in Karnataka have announced a phased strike starting March 11 to protest long-pending issues regarding promotions and cadre rules. Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao warned of legal action against those who boycott essential services, citing risks to patient care.

articles.headline: Karnataka launches action plans to eliminate rabies and reduce snakebite deaths
articles.summary: The state government launched two major public health strategies aimed at making Karnataka rabies-free and snakebite-resilient by 2030. The plans include strengthening surveillance, ensuring stocks of anti-venom, and implementing mass dog vaccination drives across 11 urban centers.

articles.headline: Karnataka government extends financial support for rare disease treatments
articles.summary: A new government order provides full financial coverage for secondary complications in rare disease patients from non-priority households under the ABArK scheme. This pilot program, with a ₹1 crore ceiling, aims to reduce the long-term financial burden on families managing complex health conditions.

articles.headline: Experts warn of health risks from excessive screen time in teenagers
articles.summary: Psychologists at the CAMVON National Conference highlighted that excessive screen use among adolescents is leading to sleep deprivation, anxiety, and behavioral issues. They advised parents to establish clear boundaries and encourage offline activities to mitigate the risks of digital addiction.

articles.headline: Meghalaya issues health alert following deaths of two Agniveer trainees
articles.summary: The Meghalaya government issued a health advisory after two Agniveer trainees died of suspected meningococcal bacterial infection in Shillong. Surveillance units have quarantined thirty other trainees and are monitoring for new cases to prevent an outbreak.

articles.headline: Denmark achieves WHO validation for eliminating mother-to-child HIV transmission
articles.summary: The WHO announced that Denmark has become the first European Union country to eliminate mother-to-child transmission of HIV and syphilis. The milestone was achieved through high coverage of prenatal testing and integrated maternal healthcare services, according to the health body.

articles.headline: Mysuru emerges as destination for slow living and artisanal café culture
articles.summary: A new wave of patissiers and baristas is transforming Mysuru into a hub for hand-crafted coffee and sourdough. These entrepreneurs are prioritizing process and community over corporate scale, reflecting a shift toward personalized work ethics.

articles.headline: Karnataka government opens barber shop for Dalits following discrimination
articles.summary: In Gadag district's Singatalur village, the social welfare department opened a state-run barber shop after local barbers refused services to Dalit residents. While officials urged for equality, Dalit activists demanded stricter laws and action against those practicing untouchability.

articles.headline: Ministry of Defence organizes employment fair for ex-servicemen in Bengaluru
articles.summary: The Directorate General Resettlement held a job fair at the MEG & Centre, where over 850 ex-servicemen applied for 780 positions. Fifty-one national and multinational companies, including BEL and Toyota Kirloskar, participated to recruit disciplined and skilled former military talent.

articles.headline: Davanagere MP appointed to India-Ukraine parliamentary friendship group
articles.summary: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has named Dr. Prabha Mallikarjun as a member of the 18th Lok Sabha's India-Ukraine parliamentary friendship group. The group, led by MP Arvind Dharamapuri, will handle bilateral issues and foster consultation between the two nations.

articles.headline: Coffee planter protests after bank issues notice for 9.34 balance
articles.summary: A Hassan coffee planter staged a protest at a Canara Bank branch after receiving a demand notice for a ₹9.34 balance on a settled loan. In response, he paid ₹10 and demanded the exact 66 paise in change, accusing the bank of humiliation over a trivial amount.

articles.headline: Six killed in Rajasthan bus collision with stationary trailer
articles.summary: A tragic collision between a sleeper bus and a stationary trailer in Rajasthan’s Balotra district resulted in the deaths of six people. Authorities are investigating the circumstances of the crash, which occurred during the early hours of Friday.

articles.headline: Surrendered Maoists witness Chhattisgarh Assembly proceedings in historic visit
articles.summary: In a historic move, 120 rehabilitated former Maoists visited the Chhattisgarh Legislative Assembly to observe democratic proceedings. Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai welcomed the group, emphasizing the state's priority in providing a life of dignity to those who abandon violence.

articles.headline: Three killed after vehicle plunges into deep gorge in Shimla
articles.summary: A tragic accident in Shimla district resulted in three deaths and two injuries when a vehicle fell into a gorge. The driver reportedly lost control near Bahlidhar, leading to the fatal plunge.

articles.headline: Bengaluru residents threaten garbage protest over 15-day collection failure
articles.summary: Residents in South Bengaluru's Yelachenahalli are threatening to dump trash at the GBA office to protest uncollected garbage piles that have persisted for two weeks. Activists claim that despite government cleanliness initiatives, local health hazards and foul smells remain unaddressed by officials.

articles.headline: Gujarat Wetland Authority fails to meet despite state's massive wetland area
articles.summary: The Gujarat government admitted in the Assembly that its State Wetland Authority has not held a single meeting in the last two years. Despite Gujarat having the highest wetland area in India, the nodal body has failed to convene to address conservation or encroachment issues.

articles.headline: Government initiates land acquisition for Arkavathi riverfront development project
articles.summary: The Bengaluru South district administration is set to acquire 28 acres for a rejuvenation project along the Arkavathi River. The plan includes walking tracks, fountains, and sewage treatment facilities to protect the ecosystem.

articles.headline: Wounded King Cobra survives emergency surgery in Himachal Pradesh
articles.summary: Veterinarians in Una successfully operated on a King Cobra that had its internal organs exposed after being run over by an earthmover. The reptile is now out of danger after a complex suturing procedure.

articles.headline: Activists and alumni demand withdrawal of FIR against APU students
articles.summary: Several organizations, including the PUCL, have condemned Azim Premji University for filing an FIR against students who organized an event related to the 1991 Kunan Poshpora incident. The groups are calling for the university to protect fundamental rights and hold those who assaulted students accountable.

articles.headline: Competitive exam aspirants demand annual KPSC and KEA schedule
articles.summary: Aspirants for Karnataka state government positions have urged authorities to release a fixed annual exam calendar similar to the UPSC's timeline. The demand stems from significant delays in results and recruitment processes, which cause mental pressure and financial constraints for candidates.

articles.headline: Karnataka II PU board exams begin today with 6.5 lakh students
articles.summary: The II pre-university board exams are commencing across Karnataka with over 1,200 centers prepared. The government has announced free bus travel for students and tightened security to prevent question paper leaks.

articles.headline: Principal of Puttur college suspended following altercation with local MLA
articles.summary: The in-charge principal of Puttur Women’s First Grade College was suspended after a student protest turned into a road blockade. Authorities cited dereliction of duty and failure to communicate student grievances to officials.

articles.headline: Gujarat students pivot to Europe as education loan disbursals decline
articles.summary: Tighter visa regimes and high costs in the US and Canada are driving Gujarati students toward cheaper European destinations. Data shows a significant drop in education loan amounts as students opt for countries like Germany.

articles.headline: India reports steady increase in bird-hit incidents involving aircraft
articles.summary: Data from the Ministry of Civil Aviation shows that bird-hit incidents in India have risen significantly over the last five years. Airports are increasingly deploying detection and deterrence technologies to mitigate aviation risks.

articles.headline: CBI Court Discharges Arvind Kejriwal and 22 Others in Excise Policy Case
articles.summary: A special CBI court has discharged former Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia, and BRS leader K Kavitha along with 20 others in the excise policy case. The judge criticized the CBI for procedural lapses and relying on hearsay evidence, stating the prosecution failed to disclose even a threshold of prima facie suspicion. While K Kavitha described the ruling as exposing a "web of lies," the CBI immediately moved the High Court to challenge the discharge.

articles.headline: High Court Orders Tahsildars to Display Pending Applications for Sakala Compliance
articles.summary: The Karnataka High Court has directed the Revenue Department to ensure that Tahsildar offices publicly display the status of all pending and disposed applications to comply with the Sakala Services Act. Expressing frustration over official delays in updating revenue records, the court also levied a fine on a specific tahsildar for failing to process a khata transfer on time. The mandate aims to bring transparency to the administrative process following registered property sales.

articles.headline: Pakistan Declares Open War on Afghanistan After Series of Border Clashes
articles.summary: Pakistan has launched airstrikes on several Afghan cities, including Kabul, after its Defense Minister declared an "open war" between the neighboring nations. The strikes reportedly killed 274 Taliban personnel in response to months of border hostilities and allegations that Afghanistan has become a hub for terrorism. In retaliation, the Taliban government reported seizing several Pakistani military posts during the ongoing clashes.

articles.headline: Former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam Joins DMK After AIADMK Expulsion
articles.summary: Expelled AIADMK leader and former three-time Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam has officially joined the ruling DMK party in the presence of Chief Minister MK Stalin. Panneerselvam, a longtime confidant of J Jayalalithaa, resigned from his assembly seat and accused AIADMK leader Palaniswami of acting like an autocrat. The move follows years of legal battles and is expected to significantly shift political influence in the state's southern districts.

articles.headline: West Bengal to Publish Final Electoral Roll with Over 7 Crore Voters
articles.summary: West Bengal is scheduled to publish its final electoral roll today following a three-month intensive revision process. While the list includes 7.08 crore names, approximately 66 lakh entries have been marked as deleted or are currently under adjudication due to lack of documentation. The final roll will be made available to the public both digitally and at administrative offices across the state.

articles.headline: TMC Names Four Rajya Sabha Candidates Including Babul Supriyo and Koel Mallick
articles.summary: West Bengal's ruling Trinamool Congress has announced four candidates for the upcoming Rajya Sabha elections, including former Union Minister Babul Supriyo and former DGP Rajeev Kumar. The diverse list of nominees also features prominent lawyer Menaka Guruswamy and actress Koel Mallick. The party stated that these selections are aimed at representing the state effectively while safeguarding the rights and dignity of Indian citizens in the Upper House.

articles.headline: Canadian PM Mark Carney Arrives in India to Reset Diplomatic Ties
articles.summary: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney has arrived in Mumbai to begin a four-day visit to India aimed at resetting frayed diplomatic relations. The visit follows a period of heightened tension over allegations involving Sikh activists that strained the bilateral partnership. Carney is seeking to double trade and strengthen economic cooperation between the two nations during his stay in New Delhi and Mumbai.

articles.headline: India’s Fiscal Deficit Reaches ₹9.8 Lakh Crore, 63% of Annual Target
articles.summary: India's fiscal deficit for the first ten months of the current financial year reached ₹9.81 trillion, representing 63% of the revised annual budget target. Total expenditure during this period reached ₹36.9 lakh crore, supported by steady tax revenues and non-tax receipts contributing to the balance. The data indicates tighter fiscal management while maintaining a continued government focus on capital expenditure and infrastructure development.

articles.headline: Unacademy Initiates ₹50 Crore Employee Stock Buyback Despite Lower Valuation
articles.summary: Unacademy founder Gaurav Munjal has announced a ₹50-crore ESOP buyback designed to provide liquidity to dozens of employees. The initiative comes despite the edtech firm's valuation dropping to $230 million in recent rounds, a significant decrease from previous peaks. Munjal thanked the company's board for supporting the cash pool, which will result in substantial payouts for eligible staff members.

articles.headline: Vaccine Maker Bharat Biotech Considers $500 Million Initial Public Offering
articles.summary: Indian vaccine developer Bharat Biotech International is reportedly weighing an initial public offering (IPO) that could raise more than $500 million. While deliberations regarding the potential listing are still ongoing, the move aims to capitalize on the company's strong post-pandemic market position. Proceeds from the offering would likely be used to expand operations and fund future global development projects.

articles.headline: Zomato Founder’s Startup Temple Raises $54 Million for Brain-Tracking Wearables
articles.summary: Temple, a health-tech wearable startup founded by Zomato’s Deepinder Goyal, has secured $54 million in seed funding at a valuation of $190 million. The company is developing a specialized device designed to measure cerebral blood flow, targeting the elite performance market. The funding round attracted several high-profile investors from the Indian startup ecosystem to support the development of this advanced wearable technology.

articles.headline: Broadband India Forum Challenges Legality of Government’s New SIM-Binding Directive
articles.summary: The Broadband India Forum (BIF) has legally challenged the government’s new SIM-binding mandate, labeling the requirement for messaging apps like WhatsApp to have an active SIM present as unconstitutional. The group argues that the mandate overreaches the Telecommunications Act and creates inconsistent compliance burdens for digital service providers. Despite these legal concerns, the Telecom Minister stated that the directive will remain in place to address national security interests.

articles.headline: OpenAI Raises $110 Billion from Amazon and Nvidia at Record Valuation
articles.summary: OpenAI has finalized a record-breaking $110 billion funding round with major participation from Amazon, Nvidia, and SoftBank, valuing the ChatGPT creator at $840 billion. As part of the deal, Amazon led the investment with $50 billion, and OpenAI agreed to utilize Amazon’s in-house Trainium AI chips for its computing needs. The massive capital injection is intended to significantly expand the company's computing power and attract top-tier AI talent.

articles.headline: Jammu and Kashmir Near Historic Maiden Ranji Trophy Title Against Karnataka
articles.summary: Jammu and Kashmir is on the verge of its first-ever Ranji Trophy title after dominating hosts Karnataka and taking a commanding 477-run lead. Despite a defiant 160-run innings from Karnataka's Mayank Agarwal, the team was bowled out for 293 thanks to a stellar five-wicket haul by seamer Auqib Nabi. The J&K side now needs just one final day of play to secure a historic victory in the prestigious domestic tournament.

articles.headline: England Defeats New Zealand to Keep Pakistan’s T20 World Cup Hopes Alive
articles.summary: England secured a thrilling four-wicket victory over New Zealand in Colombo, preventing the Kiwis from clinching an early spot in the T20 World Cup semifinals. This result keeps Pakistan’s slim chances of qualification alive, provided they beat Sri Lanka in their final group match. To advance, Pakistan must now secure a win by a massive margin to overtake their rivals on net run rate.
